configurations.name: system
configurations.description: this scope is similar to provided except that you have to provide the JAR which contains it explicitly. The artifact is always available and is not looked up in a repository.

configurations.name: master
configurations.description: contains only the artifact published by this module itself, with no transitive dependencies

configurations.name: compile
configurations.description: this is the default scope, used if none is specified. Compile dependencies are available in all classpaths.

configurations.name: provided
configurations.description: this is much like compile, but indicates you expect the JDK or a container to provide it. It is only available on the compilation classpath, and is not transitive.

configurations.name: runtime
configurations.description: this scope indicates that the dependency is not required for compilation, but is for execution. It is in the runtime and test classpaths, but not the compile classpath.

configurations.name: test
configurations.description: this scope indicates that the dependency is not required for normal use of the application, and is only available for the test compilation and execution phases.

configurations.name: default
configurations.description: runtime dependencies and master artifact can be used with this conf

configurations.name: javadoc
configurations.description: this configuration contains the javadoc artifact of this module, if any.

configurations.name: sources
configurations.description: this configuration contains the source artifact of this module, if any.
